post.author: 이진경
post.content:
SENIOR SYSTEMS ANALYSTS/LEAD PROGRAMMERS
Health And Long-Term Care

one-year temporary assignments with possible one-year extension
$51973.00 - $62556.00 / annually

Location: Kingston
Area of Search:

Bring your skills to the Ministry of Health and Long-Term Care to: prepare development plans, lead teams through systems development cycle; monitor/report on activities; recommend systems development solutions; help clients identify IT priorities; provide technical expertise in complex systems analysis/design, completion of all systems documentation/testing/implementation; provide overall systems design, lead programmer expertise, advice/expertise in acquiring soft/hardware, technology; conduct software product tendering/evaluation/selection/acquisition.

Qualifications: demonstrated current experience in IT, systems, business analysis, programming, project leadership, high-level languages, database management; working knowledge of application development environments/tools; experience with/good knowledge of mainframe technical environments, systems-development methodology, project-management disciplines/techniques; ability to effectively communicate, provide service to business partners.


Apply by Jun 07, 2002 to: File HL-47-53, Michelle Johnson, Human Services Cluster, I&IT, Ministry of Health and Long-Term Care, 49 Place d'Armes, 3rd Fl., Kingston, ON K7L 5J3. Only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

Posted: 05/24/2002
post.title: SENIOR SYSTEMS ANALYSTS/LEAD PROGRAMMERS
